characters: ONCE MORE OUT HERE AND I'LL BAKE HIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness. Distant sounds of freeway traffic. Then the clo sound of a car - its headlights illumine an oleander bush the limbs of an Eucalyptus tree. Then the headlights turn street sign is suddenly brightly lit. The words on the si read... "Mulholland Drive." The car moves under the sign it turns and the words fall once again into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gliding we follow the car - an older black Cadillac limou - as it winds its way up Mulholland Drive through the darkness of the Hollywood Hills. There is no one else on road. As we drift closer to the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men in dark suits are sitting in the front seat. A beautiful, younger, dark-haired woman sits in back. She s close up against the door and stares out into the darknes She seems to be thinking about something. Suddenly she tu and looks ahead. The car is slowing and moving off to the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? You don't stop here ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car stops - half on, half off the road at a dark, bli curve. Both men turn to the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cars - a convertible and a late model sedan are drag racing toward the blind curve blocking the view of the Cadillac limousine. The cars are filled with crazed teenagers. Two girls are standing up through the sunroof the sedan screaming as their hair is whipped straight bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars are travelling so fast that they seem to almost float as they fly with psychotic speed down both lanes of Mulholland Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver, still in his seat, has a pistol with a silenc attached pointing at the woman. The other man is getting of the car. The woman is clutching the seat and the door handle as if trying to anchor herself. She is visibly afr The man who got out of the car tries the woman's door, bu is locked. He smiles as he reaches in through the front d and unlocks her door. He opens her door. As he reaches fo her, the woman's face becomes flooded with light. Her eye dart to the front windshield. The driver, flooded with li turns just as the late model sedan slams into the Cadilla limousine. There is an explosion of metal and glass amids thunderous tearing sounds as the two cars become one in death. The convertible screams past with hardly a notice. The driver of the limousine dies instantly as his body is jettisoned through the windshield. The other man is torn the cars screech over him. The woman is brutally thrown i the back of the front seats as a cloud of dust and flying rocks engulfs her. The disastrous moving sculpture of the cars wants to climb up the hill, then stops and slides ba toward the road The Cadillac tips onto its side. Then all silent. A fire erupts in the sedan and as the dust clears see the woman appear, then crawl out of the Cadillac to t road. Her face is vacant. There is a bleeding cut just ab her forehead. She stands for a moment clutching her purse lost , then begins to walk as if in a trance across Mulholland down through the bushes and into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman slides down a hill through tangles of hostile desert plants. Sirens can be heard in the distance. She crosses through some trees and is suddenly confronted by coyote which snarls and leaps at her. She screams and str out with her purse in self defense. The coyote backs away snarling. The woman then loses control and runs at the co and it races off. She falls to the ground. We can hear th thunder of her heartbeat as the sirens grow louder. She g up and stumbles through the trees. When she clears them s is standing overlooking all of Los Angeles glowing down below. She clumsily starts down toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman slides down a dusty hill and finds herself at Franklin Avenue. A car races by and its headlights flare her face. Her expression shows fear and panic. She doesn' know where she is or where to go. She runs frantically ac the street. She moves quickly to a sidewalk which takes h into a residential area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman crosses Sunset Boulevard. Coming up Sunset in t distance is a police car with its sirens and lights going She hurries into the darkness of another residential area car turns onto the street and comes toward her. She instinctively moves behind a tree until it passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if being hunted in a foreign land the woman moves desperately down another residential street. A drunken co round the corner up ahead and start up the sidewalk towar her. She runs off the sidewalk and into the bushes in fro of an apartment building. The couple passes by without noticing her. Feeling safe in these bushes her exhaustion overtakes her and she lays her head down to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police, paramedics surround the wreckage. Two detectives, HARRY MCKNIGHT and NEAL DOMGAARD (both mid 40's to 50), s at the remains of the two cars glowing white hot under th crime scene lights. A coroner's van pulls out just after ambulance. The ambulance's siren begins to wail as it spe off. The coroner's van cruises slowly. Detective Harry McKnight and Detective Neal Domgaard continue staring. Th do not look at each other. They are each motionless for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy thinks the Caddy had stopped along the shoulder ... man up the road said he saw two cars drag racin'...then you got that blind corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men... two guns in the Caddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys found this on the floor in back of the Caddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neal holds up a plastic bag holding a pearl earring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be...any of those dead kids wearin' pearl earrings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Could be someone's missin' maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Harry McKnight turns and crosses Mulholland. Hi eyes move over each blade of grass at the shoulder - each desert bush just beyond. He slowly raises his gaze to the shining lights of Hollywood laying far below like a galax He looks out and wonders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clang of a metal gate wakes the woman. It is just get light and she sees an older red-headed woman carrying a suitcase to the curb where a cab stands waiting with its trunk open. The cab driver appears with two suitcases whi he sets down next to the car. The red-headed woman and th cab driver both go back through the iron gate. The woman the bushes pulls herself to the gate where she can peer i the courtyard of this apartment building. She sees the re headed woman and the cab driver go into an apartment and back out with more luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave the apartment door open. When the red-headed w and the cab driver reach the cab they both begin loading bags into the trunk and backseat. Their backs are to the woman in the bushes who takes this opportunity to go quic into the courtyard and through the open apartment door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman comes into a living room where a single trunk remains. She goes further into the apartment and crouches down in a back corner of the kitchen. She listens as footsteps come across the courtyard. She hears the red-he woman and the cab driver get the trunk. She hears them se down once they have it in the courtyard. She hears the st of the red-headed woman come back inside the apartment. S hears the footsteps go all around the apartment and then hears the footsteps come toward the kitchen. Remaining frozen, the dark-haired woman's eyes look up as the red- headed woman walks right past her, grabs a set of keys of the kitchen counter, then leaves the apartment. The woman hear the door being locked. She lets go, slides to the kitchen floor, and passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two well-dressed men HERB and DAN (mid 30's) are sitting table drinking coffee. Herb has finished eating his breakfast, but Dan hasn't touched his bacon and eggs - he appears too nervous to eat. A blonde waitress with a nameplate saying "DIANE" lays the check on their table smiles, then walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you want to go to breakfast if you're not hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Denny's? I wasn't going to say anything, but why Denny's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a dream about this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so you had a dream about this place. Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ... it's the second one I've had, but they were both the same......they start out that I'm in here but it's not day or night. It's kinda half night, but it looks just like this except for the light, but I'm scared like I can't tell ya. Of all people you're standing right over there by that counter. You're in both dreams and you're scared. I get even more frightened when I see how afraid you are and then I realize what it is - there's a man...in back of this place. He's the one ... he's the one that's doing it. I can see him through the wall. I can see his face and I hope I never see that face ever outside a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb stares at Dan to see if he will continue. Dan looks around nervously, then stares at his uneaten food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you came to see if he's out there? DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get rid of this god-awful feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb gets up, picks up the bill and goes to the cashier t pay. Dan just sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Herb is paying the bill he looks over at Dan just as D is turning to look at him. From Dan's point of view Herb standing in exactly the same spot as he stood in the drea Herb gets a strange feeling, turns back and finishes up w the cashier. He motions for Dan to follow him. Dan rises reluctantly and he and Herb make their way outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Herb waits for Dan to lead the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan takes Herb across the front of Denny's to a narrow sidewalk that leads down the side toward the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin walking down the narrow sidewalk - past a payphone. Dan begins to sweat the nearer he gets to the r corner of the building. Red bricks glide by slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beads of sweat cover his face. He finds it difficult to breathe. Herb is just behind him unable to see the fear overtaking his friend, but Herb can feel something himsel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red bricks moving by now are coming to an end - the corner is coming closer - the corner is now very close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a man - a face ... a face dark and bum-like- mov quickly out from behind the corner and stops - freezes - staring into Dan's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan lurches back. All his breath is suddenly gone. He fal back into Herb who tries to catch him as he's falling. Da hits the ground unable to breathe - his eyes wide with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb looks up - the man is gone. He looks down to Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan! ... Dan! You all right? ... Dan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kneels down and studies his friend. He feels for a pul in the neck. He listens for breathing. His friend is dead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airport sits in blinding sunlight and veiled with smo A big jet lands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blonde girl walking with an old woman approaches us. As blonde's face fills the screen we move with her and stay her as she goes. Her face is bright and her eyes move her and there taking in everything. She can hardly believe sh in Los Angeles - the City of Dreams. She and the old woma pass under a sign which reads "WELCOME TO LOS ANGELES." The girl smiles and looks around excited by every detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl and the old lady exit the terminal with their ba An older gentleman has joined the old lady. They stop at taxicab stand. The old lady takes the blonde girl's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to say goodbye, Betty. It's been so nice travelling with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Irene. I was so excited and nervous. It was sure great to have you to talk to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, remember I'll be watching for you on the big screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Irene. Won't that be the day. IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best of luck to you, Betty. Take care of yourself and be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty and Irene give each other a hug. The old gentleman to Betty and takes Irene off. Betty smiles after them. Suddenly someone is grabbing her bags. She turns abruptly find she is next in line and her cab is waiting. She turn once more and waves at Irene as her bags are loaded into trunk of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get into the cab and close their doors. The cab pull away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty goes from the right side of the cab to the left sid the cab looking at every building, tree and sign. Each st sign seems to be magical to her and she says the names to herself as they pass by. She sees La Tijera, La Cienega, Venice Boulevard, Pico Boulevard, Olympic Boulevard, Wils Boulevard, etc., etc. until they reach Fountain and turn right. Betty's heart is pounding when she sees Havenhurst and the cab turns left. In the middle of the block on the right the cab pulls over and stops. Betty sees her new home ... an ancient, gorgeous courtyard apartment buildin built during the golden age of cinema.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab driver puts Betty's bags down on the sidewalk nex her. She can barely stop looking at the building long eno to pay the cab driver who then goes off and drives away. Betty picks up her bags and enters, as if in a dream, thr an ornate iron gate to a courtyard with a beautiful worki fountain at its center. A sign on a door to her right rea Manager and she rings the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An older, once very beautiful, woman wearing heavy make-u and smoking a cigarette in a silver holder opens the door An unbelievable raspy voice comes out through the dark sc of the still closed screen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there...ten bucks says you're Betty. BETTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am, Mrs. Lanois. It is Mrs. Lanois isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In all my living glory, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can call me Coco ... everybody does. Stay there, I'll get the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco returns with the key and opens the screen door inhal a huge drag off her cigarette. She starts off into the courtyard and Betty picks up her bags and follows. As Coc speaks smoke comes out of her with every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it was your grandfather, was it ... he called me to check in, said you were on your way and for you to call when you get in. Nice man... farmer I hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he is. He raises corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn lot of corn raised in Hollywood these days too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to tell me. It's written all over that pretty face of yours.. You came here to be an actress. I just hope you'll remember there's never been a great poem called "tits and ass."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You probably don't remember her, but Louise Bonner lives right over there in number 29. When she isn't drunk she runs a damn good acting class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have many famous actors and actresses lived here? I was meaning to ask you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, all the great ones came through here at one time or another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A haunting music begins to swell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People say in the springtime when the wind blows the smell of the jasmine you can still feel the presence of everyone of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I've come to quite a place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, you don't know the half of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco looks down suddenly. On the cobblestone courtyard in front of her she sees a fresh product of waste from a dog She angrily turns up to an apartment on the second level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have pets do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. They're allowed, but I don't like 'em...for obvious reasons. One man used to live here that had a prize fighting kangaroo. You wouldn't believe what that kangaroo did to this courtyard ... let's see your Aunt's apartment ... it's a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dirty and torn black cocktail dress of the dark-haire woman along with her shoes, purse and undergarments are i pile in the bedroom. We drift off them toward the bathroo where the dark-haired woman can be seen showering through rippled glass. There's the sound of a door opening. We se movement through the glass and the shower goes off instan We can hear the dark-haired woman's frightened breathing she waits frozen listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty enters, thrilled with what she sees. The apartment filled with movie memorabilia, deco furniture, oriental r brass floor lamps and a massive tiled fireplace. She sets bags down and stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I guess you and your Aunt have an understanding. So here's the key and you need anything, just give a holler. (Coco hands Betty the key)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody in this building's pretty much okay with me or they wouldn't be here. If you want, later I'll introduce you around. No hard feelings if you don't, and don't forget the rooftop garden. It's just up the stairs we passed. It's open to all the tenants. You can see the Hollywood sign from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Coco thank you. Thank you so much. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it! See you later honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco leaves and closes the door behind her. Betty begins explore the apartment.- After walking a circle in the liv room she passes through the kitchen. She moves down a hallway looking at paintings and posters. She goes into t bedroom. She smiles when she sees the bed which has a hug ornately carved head and foot board. She notices the soil dress on the floor and she frowns as she looks closer. Sh stands back up, shrugs and goes into the bathroom which h all the original thirties fixtures damndest floor to ceil tiles. As she goes toward the sink she smiles to herself the mirror above it. Suddenly something catches her eye a she opens the shower stall. There before her is the naked beautiful dark-haired woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quickly closes the shower door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. My Aunt ... Ruth didn't tell me someone was going to be here. I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ruth's niece. My name's Betty. I'm sure she told you I was coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was an accident. I came here. BETTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. I saw the dress. I...I'm sorry.   Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. I was just taking a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. I'm sorry. I'll let you get back to that. I'm going to get unpacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty goes to the bathroom door and is closing it when sh stops and looks back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a close-up of the dark-haired woman. We see her ey widen with a kind of fear. She's frantically thinking - searching her mind for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'll get out of here and we can talk later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty is unpacking in the bedroom and putting her belongi in the closet and the dresser drawers. Many of her Aunt's things are still there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dark-haired woman is looking at herself in the mirror She turns and begins looking around the bathroom at shamp cosmetics, until her eyes fall on a poster of "Gilda" starring Rita Hayworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom door opens and the dark-haired woman comes o wrapped in a towel. She's drying her hair with another. S and Betty stare at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi...do you work with my Aunt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I mean......I...it's none of my business. RITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has pretty red hair... she is very kind I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sure is. She's letting me stay here while she's working on a movie that's being made in Canada, but I guess you know that.  I couldn't afford a place like this in a million years. Unless of course I'm discovered and become a movie star. Of course, I'd rather be known as a great actress than a movie star, but sometimes people end up being both and that is, I guess you'd say, sort of why I came here. I'm sorry, I'm just so excited to be here..I mean I just came here from Iowa and now I'm in this dream place. You can imagine how I feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty sits Rita on the bed. She leans down and looks at h head and face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita motions to her head above her forehead. Betty looks through her hair and finds her wound which has stopped bleeding but is surrounded by a very large blue black bruising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, this could be serious. RITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have a concussion you shouldn't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be okay if I sleep. I need to lie down and sleep. BETTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, but...I'm going to check on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita lies down and is instantly asleep. Betty leans over and listens to her breathing. She gets a blanket and drap it over the beautiful sleeping Rita, then leaves the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street level of the office building is filthy and hou stores selling racks of cheap toys. Up above we see offic windows and a big sign saying "Office Space For Rent" alo with a telephone number to call. We drift in toward one o the windows on the sixth floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men are in the room, JOE and ED. Joe leans up against rack of filing cabinets. He is in his late twenties. He looks like a run down, heavy metal rocker - wears a blue denim shirt open, T-shirt underneath, black denim jeans a motorcycle boots. His black belt has silver studs. He's smoking a cigarette and is laughing at something the man the desk has said. His laugh is easy and his grin is infectious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man at the desk, Ed, wears a clean, crisp black suit, like a business man's but unlike a business man his blond hair is long enough to go over his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So man, that's unheard of ... an accident like that ... who coulda foreseen that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unreal ... so, you're looking good. Whatcha doin' these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not much Ed. Just doin' some stuff for this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, look at my digs ... times are tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, things aren't so bad. Gee, I hope you're not goin' to get in any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just a thing. The story made you laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking like he's rubbing the small of his back Joe moves over to Ed at his desk. Joe looks down to the surface of desk - to a small worn black book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, there it is ... Ed's famous black book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the history of the world in phone numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's hand still at the small of his back moves into view holding a silenced pistol and in one swift move reaches o and fires a hole through Ed's temple - blowing Ed's brain out across the desk, carpet and wall. Ed's head bangs dow on the desk, then is still save the leaking of blood from wounds. Joe flips his finished cigarette out the open win behind Ed's desk, wipes the gun clean with a handkerchief places the cleaned gun in Ed's right hand. He places Ed's right forefinger gently onto the trigger. As he puts the finger on the trigger he presses a little too hard and th gun goes off. The bullet shoots out and penetrates the ch wall at the far end of Ed's office. Joe hears a muffled scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a sense of "just more stuff I got to do" Joe moves slowly and begrudgingly out of Ed's office, checks the corridor and goes toward the screaming which still persis He opens up the office door next to Ed's and finds a heav set woman screaming bloody murder as she is grabbing her buttock and lower back. He sighs and walks over to her an cups his hand tightly around her mouth to squelch the screaming. Wide-eyed, she tries to fight him off and he begins dragging her out of her office. Joe's foot catches a computer cable clumsily taped across the floor and he f backwards bringing the heavy woman down with a bone-crush blow on top of him. The woman begins beating his face wit her meaty fists. Joe snaps her head back, instantly still her violent activity. He wrestles the stunned heavyweight back to her feet and out her door. He pushes and pulls he into Ed's office. Just before they enter, Joe notices a m with a vacuum cleaner watching him from the far end of th corridor. He stops and calls to the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man. She's hurt bad. Get down here and use the phone. Help me out. You gotta call the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man hesitates...not sure if this jives with what he's seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it! Get down here quick! She's hurt and I can't do everything myself, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe pushes the woman inside Ed's office, throws a glance down the corridor and sees the man is on his way to him, pushing his industrial vacuum and trailing a 200 ft. long thick black cord as he goes. Joe goes in to Ed's office with the woman. He throws her down on the floor in line between Ed's desk and the bullet hole in the wall. She starts screaming immediately and struggles to get up. Joe grabs the pistol from Ed's dead hand and lifts it to fire but the woman has turned around and is almost standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. You gotta be turned around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to her, slaps her hard in the face and spins her around. Before she can turn again Joe races back to place himself in the proper line at Ed's desk and quickly fires silenced shots into the back of her head. The man with th vacuum enters. His eyes begin to widen in reaction to the scene. Just then Joe fires a bullet into the man's chest. The man inadvertently flicks on the vacuum cleaner as his hands rush up to the wound. As the vacuum cleaner whines rushes to the man before the man falls back out into the corridor. He pulls him into the room - the man moaning an clutching his chest, starting to collapse. Joe releases h and the man goes down. The vacuum cleaner seems to be screeching now in the threshold. Joe fires the last bulle into the heavy duty vacuum cleaner. The bullet shorts out the internal wiring of the vacuum. That in turn blows the building's circuit breaker and all the lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he hears voices - voices moving into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell .... what happened? What's this cord doing here? It's the vacuum. It's the vacuum what did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe cleans the pistol once again and places it back in Eddie's hand - Eddie's finger on the trigger. Joe picks u the black book - turns and makes his escape by going out office window and quickly descending the rusty fire escap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see three men sitting at a conference table RAYMOND(RA HOTT -president of production, wearing a crisp blue suit,VINCENT DARBY -senior vice-president, wearing a cris green suit and ROBERT SMITH -talent manager, wearing a cr brown suit. Ray and Mr. Darby sit at the head of the tabl and Robert Smith sits along the side. A younger man -ADAM KESHER enters and sits down, with an arrogant nonchalance next to Robert Smith. Adam is dressed in a frumpy old fashioned plaid shirt, worn jacket, dark blue cotton slac and a pair of old brown wing tips. As he sits he is holdi and twirling a vintage "7-iron" golf club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why did you idiots bring me here? ... I'm in the middle of making a picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence for a moment. A man enters through a rear door an whispers something to Mr. Darby and shows him something o piece of paper. Mr. Darby studies the piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man who entered points to something on the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's try the next one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello ... who're we talkin' about here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert Smith shuffles nervously in his chair next to Adam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see Adam... there are some suggestions which are to be brought forward ... and I know you said you would entertain suggestions and that's all anybody here is asking you to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An open mind ... You're in the process of re-casting your lead actress and I'm... (looks around) We're asking you to keep an open mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before us is a huge modern office building of glass and steel. Two men in dark suits have exited a large limousin and are walking up into the building. We drift up the fac higher and higher moving in toward the top of the buildin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men exit an elevator and move through a lobby where a plaque beneath an enormous bronze sculpture reads "Ryan Entertainment". Gliding we travel behind the two men down wide, carpeted hallway with blonde wood and glass on each side. They enter through two large blonde wooden doors to conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men in dark suits go in as if they owned the place. R Mr. Darby and Robert Smith stand immediately. Adam remain seated. Mr. Darby is the only one near enough to attempt hand shake, but when he offers his hand it is not taken. men in dark suits sit down without wasting a movement and without acknowledging anyone. One of the men in a dark su opens a briefcase. Ray has been trying to make introductions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... the Castigliane brothers. Let me introduce you around ... please ... sit down. (after they've already seated themselves) ... this is Mr. Darby whom you know and this is the director Adam Kesher and his manager Robert Smith

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Castigliane brothers do not acknowledge any of this, however, during the introductions the one with the briefc removes a photo of a girl and sets it in front of Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the photo of the girl - of a nice looking blonde - someone we've never seen before. Adam looks like he doesn know what's going on and he's getting upset about not knowing. His manager, Robert Smith, is beginning to see t makings of a confrontation - he's starting to panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I offer you gentlemen anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. DARBY (picking up phone and speaking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One espresso ... no, that's it. (sets phone down - addresses Castigliane brothers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're going to enjoy your espresso this time... I've been doing quite a bit of research knowing how hard you are to please... this one comes highly recommended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A recommendation... a recommendation to you Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What girl? For what? What is this Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, still standing with a forced smile, turns to the Castigliane brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd be happy to put her in the pile for considerations ... you'd be pleased to know there's quite a lot of interest in this role.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interest?! There's six of the top actresses that want this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray...you better take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on!!!!!!!! There's no way, there's no way!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luigi Castigliane's espresso is brought in by the man who been in earlier. The man sets the espresso down in front Luigi and takes a step back. The room becomes silent - watching the Espresso Man and Luigi. Without looking up L speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Espresso Man leaves the room. Luigi looks at the espresso. Vincenzo stares at Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is doing his best to stare down Vincenzo. The Espres man returns with a cloth napkin and lays it down next to espresso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luigi doesn't answer and after a moment of standing very still waiting, the Espresso Man turns and leaves the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is stared down by Vincenzo and averts his eyes to th espresso cup. He looks around at Ray and Mr. Darby - seei them stare at the espresso cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luigi picks up the napkin and holds it in his left hand. With his right hand he lifts the espresso cup and places above the napkin. He brings the cup and napkin to his mou He takes a sip of espresso. A small fleeting expression f on Luigi's impassive face as if for one millisecond he is going to vomit. His mouth opens and he allows the espress to fall and dribble onto the napkin. He pushes any remain espresso in his mouth out with his tongue. He holds it in that position for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. That was a highly recommended...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's considered one of the finest espressos in the world , Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luigi just stands there. A small thread on his left suit jacket pocket catches his attention and he smooths it bac into the fabric. Vincenzo closes his briefcase, takes out hankerchief and cleans his nose - then stands, placing th handkerchief back in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute!! What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincenzo just stares toward Adam as if he's not even ther

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way that girl is in my movie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Castigliane brothers begin to leave. Adam stands up trembling with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!!!!! That girl is not in my film!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is no longer your film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam turns white and stands very still as this sinks in. Castigliane brothers leave. As the big blonde wood doors close behind them Adam starts to boil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'd better speak to someone too ... or find yourself another client!! This smells like a set-up to me! (back to Ray)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by the way, Ray, I don't know who these guys are kidding, but every foot of film I've shot is in a vault at the lab that only I can access. No one's getting that film!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a catastrophe... (turning toward Ray)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you told me they might insist on a girl, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me, Robert? That's what I mean ... you set me up! I woulda never come here. (standing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving. I'm a director you don't want to lose ... you guys better fix this!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam storms out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I didn't know that was going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam exits the building carrying his 7-iron. An attendant takes his valet parking ticket. While Adam, still fuming, waits for his car he notices the big limo standing off to side. He stares at the car and the huge limo driver leani up against the front driver's side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam's car arrives - a late model Porsche. Before Adam ge into his car he addresses the attendant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the Castigliane brothers get out of that limo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They two guys in dark suits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam nods and walks over to the limo. The limo driver eye him and his 7-iron suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam raises his 7-iron and smashes out the limo's windshi He whacks two big dents in the hood, then smashes out a headlight. The limo driver starts towards him. Adam laugh runs to his car and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty is stretched out on the big leather couch in the li room. A half eaten sandwich and chips are on a plate on t coffee table next to her. She is talking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Grandpa, you wouldn't believe it. It's more beautiful than I ever dreamed ... no she left me a lot of food. The refrigerator's full ... Aunt Ruthie said she'd call me when she got settled... it was real smooth. I sat next to a lady who gave up her first class seat to a boy with a broken leg. She was so nice to me. She invited me to her house sometime. It's in Bel Air which is a place where people have a lot of money... I will. Everybody's telling me to be careful, but I sure love it here Grandpa. Thank you for helping me get here ... yeah, it's long distance. I love you. Say hello to Grams. Give her a big kiss for me. Okay, I love you Grandpa ... bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty hangs up the phone, takes a big bite of her sandwic and lays flat out on the couch, chewing and smiling up at ceiling. She suddenly remembers Rita and her promise to l in on her. She gets off the couch and goes into the bedro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita is still asleep when she enters. She leans down and finds Rita breathing normally. She feels her forehead. Satisfied that all is well, Betty quietly leaves the bedr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty rinses her dishes in the kitchen sink and pours her a cup of coffee. She takes the coffee outside to the courtyard - to a white metal table just outside her doorw She sits down and stretches in the warm afternoon sun. Across the way she can hear a blues saxophonist practicin one of the apartments. She drinks her coffee and listens the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some birds fly by overhead. She takes another sip of coff The blues music which was mellow and slow is now building tempo and volume. The phone inside rings. Betty takes her coffee back into the living room, shutting the door behin her. She crosses to the leather couch and picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello ... Aunt Ruth!! I can't tell you how happy I am. Your place is so fantastic! Yes ... Coco...what a character. I really like her... that's too bad...waiting in an airport must not be too fun. What's a mosquito plane? ... Oh I get it. How long does that take from Montreal? ... Well, you'll sleep good tonight ... Hudson Bay sounds beautiful ...oh well, I hope you packed your coat. (laughs). You mean the audition...Wally Brown... she didn't mention it but he'll fax the dialogue to Coco? Suddenly I'm so nervous ... okay Aunt Ruth... I'll try. I'll study those lines until I know them inside out. Yes, either right here on this fabulous leather couch or I'll take them with a coffee in the courtyard like a regular movie star. (laughs). Oh! I got a real shock to find your friend Rita here. She was in the shower and I opened the door ... Rita ... what do you mean? She was in an accident ... your friend Rita. No, Coco unlocked the door. No, she didn't see her. She's sleeping. No... she's very nice. I'm sure there's some explanation, Aunt Ruth... I don't think we have to do that. Please don't worry. I'll take care of it. No, I'll let you know. Where can I ... okay I'll get it from Coco. No, please don't worry... thank you so much for letting me stay here. You've made me so happy... thank you, thank you. Please don't worry... Aunt Ruth we don't need the police. I'll call you when you get to Hudson Bay. Please... please ... Goodbye Aunt Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty slowly and quietly hangs up the phone. She sits for moment listening. Silently she stands and moves toward th bedroom. As she approaches the bedroom door she stops at something she sees. Rita is sitting on the edge of the be crying quietly. Betty goes into the bedroom. Rita looks u at her with desperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're awake... I think I misunderstood you. I thought you knew my Aunt and that's why you were here. I just talked to my Aunt on the phone and she wants me to call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita starts crying harder, bows down, covering her face w her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... sorry. I ... Betty's heart softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm...I'm... oh no... I thought when I woke up... I thought sleep would do it ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty kneels down in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? You're Rita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. I don't know what my name is. I don't know who I am!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty looks down at the purse next to Rita's dress. She p it up and hands it to Rita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your purse. Your name must be in your purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita takes the purse with sudden trepidation. She hesitat Something is worrying her. She looks at Betty for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita slowly unzips the purse. The pressure of its content force the mouth of the purse to widen as the zipper opens then there is suddenly revealed what will later be known be $125,000.00 cash in hundred dollar bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Rita and Betty almost stop breathing. They look at e other, then back to the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita takes the massive wad of bills out of the purse and it on the bed. She reaches back inside and comes up with only other remaining item in the purse ... A BLUE KEY. Be sees Rita's expression change to a kind of horror. (note: This blue key is made of very fine heavy metal and does not look like a door key.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray crosses a carpeted closed area. He mounts a flight of stairs. At the top of the stairs there's a plain blonde w door. Ray punches in a code on a security panel next to i The door opens automatically. Ray passes through and goes down a narrow hall. At the end of the hall there is a sma elevator. Again Ray punches in a code. The elevator opens Ray goes in. The elevator door closes, but the elevator d not move. Ray waits. Finally, a woman's voice comes throu speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator begins to move up. When it stops, the door o and Ray walks into a windowless reception area where a beautiful Italian woman sits behind a large, blonde, mode built-in desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may go right in, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray crosses to a blonde wood double door and waits. The receptionist pushes a button behind her desk - chimes sou as the double doors open to an enormous office with no windows. Heavy rich brown curtains line the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray enters and the doors close behind him. Ray takes a fe steps forward, then stops. There is a solid glass wall th we now notice running the width of the office. Cut into t glass wall is a small speaker microphone apparatus. Beyon the glass off in the center of the room is a man sitting very plain, blonde, wood, modern, yet not motorized, wheelchair. The man is paralyzed except for his right han and head. His head appears small in relation to the size his body. His suit is immaculate and one of the finest we ever seen. His manservant stands in the shadows behind hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Roque stares at Ray silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then... I guess it's so .... alright, but that means we should ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut everything down ... Is that something that...do you want us to shut everything down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Ray doesn't know what to do. He struggles to interpret Mr. Roque's silence. He waits. Mr. Roque does nothing but stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray turns. The doors open as he approaches them and he leaves the room. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincenzo and Luigi are staring silently and without expression at the broken windshield of the limousine. The limousine driver suddenly starts signaling to a car enter the driveway to the building. He turns to the Castigliane brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other car is here sirs. Please allow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo driver opens the rear door of the new limo, then hurries around and opens the other rear door. The new dri gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the key to the car. Take it straight to the garage. They're waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo driver closes both back doors after the Castigli brothers are seated within. He then gets in himself and maneuvers the big limo out into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guys, JOE ( the guy who killed Ed in the sixth floor office) and BILLY another unkept, rocker type delivery ma are standing waiting for their chili dogs with a girl, LA who could be very good looking but she seems to be in poo health. Her hair is long and stringy. She's wearing a tight, short sleeve blue sweater, black jeans and boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Look what happened to them. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, I told you. They're fine. They're all real happy. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My next delivery is up that way, so I'll be getting down to it real soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta keep an eye on her, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep her from gettin' in trouble, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chili dogs arrive and they pay for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we eat in the van?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... I don't like being out in the open like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be just so pathetic being you. Sure Billy, grab your dog we'll eat in the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three make their way to the van. Joe looks over at Laney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you don't want anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ... thanks though... I'll take a cigarette if you have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, reach in my shirt pocket there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Laney is getting her cigarette and lighting it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any new girls on the street these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll keep your eyes open for me won't you baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe spanks her butt as she gets in the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Roque, in his wheelchair is still in the center of th huge softly lit, windowless office. His manservant standi silently behind him. The small built-in wheelchair phone rings. Mr. Roque pushes a button on a small intricate rem device he holds in his right hand. A slender streamlined microphone rises from the arm of the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens through a high-tech earplant which we now see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes two buttons, one after another on the remote device. We hear a small click, a dial tone, a number bein dialed, and a phone ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the back of a man's head and just over his shoulde see the top of the phone which is ringing. The man picks the phone and brings the receiver to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a small click and the line goes dead. Mr. Roque pushes a button and the microphone descends back into the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again we see the back of the man's head. He's dialing a n number. -He brings the receiver to his ear. We hear a pho ringing - we hear a click- the phone being answered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see only a black rotary wall phone and a portion of a greasy filthy kitchen - The receiver has already been lif off the phone and we see only the cord extending to someo off screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again we see only the back of the man's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man's hairy-arm enters frame and the receiver is placed back on the phone, then immediately picked back up and wi the receiver held in the hand the hairy man dials a new number. Part way through the dialing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surface of this table is high gloss ultra smooth material. A very modern phone sits on this table and begi to ring softly. A hand enters frame - a woman's hand. The skin is pale white, almost translucent. The fingers are l and seem slightly too large. At the ends of the fingers a thumb are stretched tapered high gloss red fingernails wh slightly curve downward. The forefinger of the hand press a button on the phone. A small tone sounds - followed by very modern sounding coded signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull back from Rita's face until we see that Betty and Rita are sitting on the leather couch about four feet apa staring at the floor. They just sit this way for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...  what do you think about then? I mean...  well what do you think about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ... if you don't remember anything, I mean what goes through your mind then if you don't remember anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I do remember the car crash... I told you... I remember the glass ... I think about that sometimes ... I remember walking here, sort of. Now I remember this place and you. That's about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you remember how to talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No (she covers her eyes with her hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something...something there I can't tell... I can't describe it. (struggling to figure it out - to express it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are things there.... but I'm... here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty thinks about what Rita has said. Somehow it seems t make sense to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money. You don't know where it came from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you think about them... the money... the key ... does it make you remember anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money... I don't know about the money... the key... it makes me feel ... afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car - a late model generic sedan is moving toward us. T men dressed in suits and wearing dark glasses are driving slowly. As they go each man is scanning sidewalks, buildings, passing cars as if hunting for someone. They p by us and as we turn we leave them and pick-up Adam drivi in the opposite direction in the other lane. We stay with Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam drives his Porsche up a palm lined street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice activated phone connects the line to Adam's off A secretary answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on the set. I'll connect you Mr. Kesher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another ringing sound, then a voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, I have Mr. Kesher for Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right baby, all Hell's broke loose down here. I'll try to find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam listens to dead silence for a moment or two then Cyn speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've closed the set. They sent everybody home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray did ... and then they closed the set.... everybody's gone. You'd better get down here Adam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to talk to Ray you've got to fix this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home! Meet me at the office. We've got to do something ... you've got to do something Adam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, this isn't like you. Please come to the office. There must be something we can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going home. I'll call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are still sitting on the leather couch as befor but now silently off in their own worlds. After a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder where you were going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty's question hangs in the air. Slowly we move close t Rita who is on the verge of remembering something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where I was going... Mulholland Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's where the accident was. There must be a police report. We could call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could call anonymously from a pay phone... just to see if there was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. It'll be just like in the movies. We'll pretend to be someone else. I want to walk around anyway. I'm in Hollywood and I haven't even seen any of it. Come on Rita. Do you feel up to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... but just...just to see. BETTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to see if there was an accident on Mulholland Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... let's find you something to wear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty laughs as she holds one of Ruth's dresses in front Rita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's terrible ... My Aunt dresses like Miss Marple. (off a blank stare from Rita )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's kind of a frumpy woman detective in British movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita laughs along with Betty. Betty goes back in the clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brings out a pair of khaki pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try these on. You can wear one of my T- shirts with it and it won't look bad with those sandals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam pulls into his driveway, but is blocked from enterin the garage by a poolman's truck. He gets out of the car a looks at the truck - sees the insignia on the door which blue square with the word "Gene" above and the word "Clea below. Adam hears steps behind him and turns. A JAPANESE GARDENER is coming toward him smiling and bowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Mister ... you remember me. I am Taka. your gardener. For long time I not see you. I pleased to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taka reaches out his hand and Adam shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Taka. It's 'cause I'm never home in the day time. It's good to see you again. The garden looks great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taka bows, smiling and nodding, and goes back to work. Ad heads toward the front door of his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam enters, puts his 7-iron in his golf bag just inside door, then looks around. He can see the pool through a wa of plate glass windows, but there is no one visible pools

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears a noise, something falling. He walks in the direction of the noise. It leads him to his bedroom. His expression darkens as he approaches the closed door. He hears voices as he throws the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORRAINE and the poolman GENE are in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just forget you ever saw it. It's better that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you even doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam stands stunned for a moment. Then finds himself walk over to the dresser and opening the top drawer. He remove large case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam starts walking out of the bedroom with the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam leaves the bedroom and starts through the house. He goes into the kitchen and looks around - numb but trying think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine is getting dressed as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam leaves the kitchen and goes out into the garage. He turns on the light and looks around. He spots some paint cans on a shelf and grabs one and goes back into the kitc He can hear Lorraine calling his name. She seems to be coming closer. He sets the jewelry case and the paint can the floor, kneels down and opens the paint can with his c key. Just as Lorraine enters the kitchen, he opens the jewelry box and empties the 3/4 full gallon can of Hot Pi paint into her jewelry case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his hands into the paint and jewels and smushes t about. Lorraine rushes toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine grabs hold of him. Starts pulling his hair, slapping his face. She tears his jacket. Adam stands all once and with his wet Hot Pink hands he pushes Lorraine a slams her into the kitchen counter just as Gene the poolm enters. Gene grabs ahold of Adam, cocks back and slams hi huge suntanned fist into Adam's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a way to treat your wife, buddy. I don't care what she's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam gets up off the floor bleeding from the nose and tri to hit Gene. Gene blocks his punch and slams Adam again, knocking him down to the kitchen floor where he lands and spills the jewelry case. Adam, now covered with paint, is picked up by Gene and thrown out toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorraine opens the front door while Gene picks Adam up, m him across the carpet and heaves him out onto the front l Lorraine slams the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam picks himself up, severely dazed and bleeding pretty badly, he heads for his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taka stops gardening and smiles and bows at Adam as he ge into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam drives away - pink paint and red blood all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita is now dressed to go out and is studying herself in mirror. She turns and her gaze falls to her purse. She picks it up and looks questioningly at Betty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ... you shouldn't take that. Let's hide it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look around the room... There's a hatbox in the clos above the clothes rack. Betty brings it down, takes out t hat, and Rita puts the purse inside. Betty puts the hat o the purse in the hatbox and puts in back in the closet. Betty puts out her hand. Rita looks at it for a moment, smiles, and they shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All dressed now Betty and Rita leave Aunt Ruth's apartmen and walk across the courtyard past Coco's apartment and o through the iron gates. No one is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty and Rita walk along. Birds are chirping in the tree which line both sides of the street. Betty is smiling and once again looking around at everything. Her good mood an excitement about life lifts Rita's spirits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming toward them on the sidewalk are two people - a mid aged woman and a young boy around 10 years old. The boy i very thin and something is wrong with him as he is walkin awkwardly on crutches. As the two groups pass each other the sidewalk Betty is struck deeply by the boy's brillian luminous blue eyes which are at once innocent and filled wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After they pass each other Betty turns back and sees the and the woman enter 1612 Havenhurst. Betty and Rita conti up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls walk along the busy boulevard, past guitar shop video stores. Betty is looking for a payphone. Rita's eye dart back and forth nervously. She's beginning to feel frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the red brick building. It is Denny's. Betty and Rita are walking to the payphone. Betty digs out some cha from her purse. She picks up the receiver, drops in a quarter and dials the "0" for Operator. An Operator answe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I just want the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty gets the number for the Hollywood Police Station, r deposits the quarter and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm inquiring about an accident that happened last night on Mulholland Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold please. I'll connect you to traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm inquiring ...well, I heard a sound last night that sounded like a car crash and I want to know if there was an accident on Mulholland Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell me what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have your name please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty hangs up. She turns to Rita smiling like a girl who done something bad and gotten away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was an accident. He wouldn't tell me anything else, but that was your accident Rita. I just know it was. Maybe there's something about it in the papers. Come on I'll buy you a cup of coffee and we can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita and Betty are seated next to the table where Dan and Herb sat earlier in the day. They both have a cup of coff in front of them. Betty has a newspaper open and she is scanning the last pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it happened so late it's not going to be in today's paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same waitress - Diane, comes up to the girl's table a freshens up their coffee. Betty looks up and smiles, sees Diane's nameplate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita shoots a look from Betty to Diane to the nameplate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word "DIANE" is huge from Rita's POV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane finishes pouring Rita's cup and smiles at Betty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. Will that be all? You want your check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the coffee. Rita, you want something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RITA (still staring at the nameplate - thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane searches through her many checks to find Betty and Rita's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager of Denny's, standing with a woman in a blue dress, calls Diane's name. Diane turns and looks to the manager and the woman. A fleeting fear goes through her eyes. She surreptitiously reaches in her pocket and takes out a Mont Blanc fountain pen which she puts under Betty' check as she places it on their table. She does this very quickly but Betty notices this and Diane notices Betty noticing. Diane walks quickly over to the manager and the woman in the blue dress. Betty turns and watches a heated conversation that she can't hear, but she sees the woman the blue dress searching her purse and shrugging and then leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager says something to Diane and Diane turns her pockets inside out and pats herself down in front of the manager showing him her innocence. He waves her off and s goes behind the counter to retrieve an order of food. Bet stops watching and turns her attention to Rita, who is te and lost in a thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment Diane the waitress reappears at their tabl Diane looks Betty in the eye and while looking at Betty h left hand slides the Mont Blanc out from under the check back into her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relieved Diane leaves and goes about her business. Betty looks over at Rita waiting for her to tell her something. Rita slowly turns and focuses on Betty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember something... I remember something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty and Rita are walking back to the apartment. We see them from a distance. They are talking and gesturing in a excited and animated way. Just after they enter through t iron gates of 1612 Havenhurst and are out of sight we not a car moving slowly up Havenhurst toward us. We notice tw men in the front seat who seem to be looking around for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slams shut. Rita grabs Betty's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane Selwyn. Maybe it's my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty and Rita are sitting next to each other on the leat couch. Betty is rifling through the phone book. She finds the listings for Selwyn. Her finger drifts down and finds Selwyn followed by an address and phone number. It is the only Selwyn with a D. first name. She hands the phone to Rita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty reads the number off and Rita pushes the correspond buttons. Each tone seems to be louder than the last. The ringing seems deafening. There's a click and the phone is answered - by a machine. A woman's voice is heard - loudl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi ... this is me. Leave me a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty now has her ear pressed up against the phone also - straining to hear everything. The machine starts recordin Betty hangs up the phone immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my voice ... but I know her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the voice isn't Diane Selwyn. Maybe that's your roommate or if it is Diane Selwyn she can tell you who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taka is bowing and smiling and nodding to someone we don' see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAKA'S POV - A man, KENNY, in a sharp black suit is walki down the driveway past Gene the Poolman's truck to the fr door of Adam's house. Parked at the street is a big limo with Vincenzo and Luigi Castigliane sitting in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny knocks on Adam's front door. Lorraine answers. Lorraine's hands are covered with pink paint. Pink paint on her face and clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slams the door, but Kenny's foot stops it and pushes back with a force that shakes the wall as the door slams once again. Kenny enters the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Adam Kesher's house. Where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell it is! Get out ... NOW!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gene comes out of the kitchen fast, his hands covered wit pink paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you don't understand English. She asked to leave. Here's the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gene grabs hold of Kenny and starts to push him out the d Kenny rabbit punches Gene in the nose with lightning spee his fist like a sledgehammer. Gene goes down. Lorraine shrieks and leaps on Kenny. Her long fingernails going fo his eyes. Kenny slaps Lorraine hard. The shriek stops instantly and she falls out cold on the carpet. Gene is b up and going for Kenny. Kenny gets three punches in on Ge head before Gene hits the ground unconscious. Kenny rubs pink paint off his hands and tries to get a pink stain of his jacket. He begins walking around the house calling ou for Adam. He sees nothing and hears nothing. He goes back the front door and sees Adam's golf clubs sitting there. Kenny begins snapping the shaft of each club. As he snaps each club we see Lorraine and Gene remain out cold on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the kitchen we see that the tap is on and the sink water is now overflowing from the sink and jewelry box - spilling out onto the kitchen floor. Finishing his work w the vintage golf clubs - Kenny leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny jumps into the front seat of the limo. Vincenzo and Luigi nod to the driver and they take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taka hoes some weeds beneath a Jacaranda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night descends on Los Angeles. Millions of lights down be twinkle like stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the courtyard at night. Some of the apartment wind have dim, warm lights. Most all is in darkness. The only sound is the water flowing in the fountain with muted dis traffic. Far away a siren wails softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty and Rita are on their hands and knees around the co table. A map of L.A. is unfolded and Betty is running her finger along a street. Her finger stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's right about here on Sierra Bonita. That's not too far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An older, beautiful woman - drunk, is walking slowly - strangely toward the door of Aunt Ruth's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're afraid of something. We'll be careful. Tomorrow we'll go over there and we'll find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman moves up to the door we see her face. Her eyes the eerie look of one possessed. She knocks mechanically the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty and Rita both turn with alarm. Betty gets up, stare at the door, then at Rita. Rita waits, not knowing what t do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty opens the door. Betty finds the face of the actress LOUISE BONNER, staring questioningly at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth's gone on a film. I'm her niece Betty.   Who are you? LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone is in trouble. Who are you? Why are you in Ruth's apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm her niece. She's letting me stay here. My name is Betty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it isn't. That's not it. That's not what she said. Something bad's happening. Where's Ruth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but I don't know who you are and I'm... COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise... what're are you doing Louise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise turns and sees Coco approaching across the courtya

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been Coco? God, I've been trying to find you all afternoon since 3:00 o'clock. That one is in my room and she won't leave. I want you to get her out. I want you to get her out now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco comes up and grabs hold of Louise. She turns over to Betty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Louise Bonner. I'm sure she meant well. (looking over to Louise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Betty, Ruth's niece. In fact and fortunately I was just coming to see Betty. Betty's a young actress and I'm delivering faxed pages of a scene for her audition tomorrow. Here they are honey. Now come along Louise and I'll take you home. (back to Betty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about this. Sometimes it happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she said it was someone else in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Louise. Let's get you home ... goodnight Betty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco takes Louise back through the darkness of the courty Betty closes the door and turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She catches Rita's look. Rita is staring at her, horrifie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Hotel Manager is walking toward the door of room 214. H knocks softly on the door. The door opens and Adam Kesher standing there - still beaten looking with remnants of pi paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Mr. Kesher, but there seems to be some problem concerning your credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fact is Mr. Kesher a representative of your bank called us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How...  how'd they know I was here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. All we do is take an impression of the credit card and until you check out it just sits in our files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Sir, I'm afraid they said you're overdrawn at your bank and your line of credit has been cancelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable. Look... here. (Adam taking out his wallet.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what's going on. That's so much baloney. I've got enough cash for one night, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine, Mr. Kesher. You can pay cash when you check out. I'm sorry. it was my duty to inform you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I'll check out in the morning. HOTEL MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good evening, Mr. Kesher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hotel Manager turns to leave and Adam closes the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam crosses the room to the phone and dials a number. Th phone is answered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  Where are you Adam? ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone called me. When they couldn't get you they told me you were as good as broke. I didn't believe then, so I made some calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but you're broke. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly Hills Hotel. I've got enough cash in my pocket for one night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know somebody called the The Cowboy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the Cowboy. This guy, the Cowboy, wants to see you. Jason said he thought it would be a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jason thought it would be a good idea for me to meet the Cowboy. Should I wear my ten gallon hat and my six shooters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something tells me this guy is connected with what's happening, Adam, and I think you should do it and I think you should do it right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a very strange day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And getting stranger. Where do I meet this Cowboy? I mean do I have to ride out to the range?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of, funny boy. If I tell him the meeting's on you're to go to the top of Beachwood Canyon. There's a corral up there where he'll be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. It is that kind of a day. When? CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call him, then call you back...If you want you could stay at my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia... that would not be a good idea. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just offering a place to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
